title: ALKE
content:
ALKE was the personification (daimona) of battle-strength, prowess and courage. She was one of the
        spirits of the aigis (aegis)--the tasselled arm-guard of Zeus--, the others being Eris (Strife), Phobos (Terror) and Ioke
        (Onslaught).

Alke was probably numbered amongst the battle-spirits known as Makhai (Machae).

Homer, Iliad 5. 738 ff (trans. Lattimore) (Greek epic C8th B.C.) :
        "Across her [Athena's] shoulders she threw the betasselled, terrible aigis (aegis), all about
        which Phobos (Terror) hangs like a garland, and Eris (Hatred) is there, and Alke (Battle-Strength), and
        heart-freezing Ioke (Onslaught) and thereon is set the head of the grim gigantic Gorgo (Gorgon), a thing of fear
        and horror, portent of Zeus of the aigis." [N.B. The daimones (spirits) imbued the aigis with its power.]
